stateWideResources.name: 2-1-1 Arizona
stateWideResources.description: 2-1-1 Arizona is a comprehensive information and referral service that connects individuals and families to over 8,500 local and statewide resources. The service helps people find assistance with basic needs, housing, utilities, food, healthcare, employment, and other essential services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: Dial 2-1-1 within Arizona | 877-211-8661 from anywhere | Fax: 602-263-0979 | Arizona Relay: 7-1-1 or 800-367-8939 | Address: 1275 W. Washington St. Suite 210, Tempe, AZ 85288
stateWideResources.notes: Available by phone from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. Monday through Friday. Website search available 24/7. Cannot help people in person at their office.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: A statewide coalition that provides support, resources, and advocacy for victims of sexual and domestic violence across Arizona. They operate a 24/7 helpline and connect survivors with local services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 602-279-2980 or 1-800-782-6400 (Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline) | Email: Contact through website form | Address: Phoenix, Arizona (serves statewide)
stateWideResources.phone: 602-279-2980 or 1-800-782-6400 (Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline)
stateWideResources.eligibility: Victims of sexual and domestic violence in Arizona
stateWideResources.hours: 24/7 helpline; Office hours by appointment only
services: Connection to local domestic violence programs

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: A statewide coalition providing support, resources, and advocacy for victims of sexual and domestic violence across Arizona. They operate the Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline, offering multiple ways to connect with support services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 602-279-2900 (Office), 800-782-6400 (Helpline) | Email: info@acesdv.org | Address: 2800 N. Central Ave., Suite 1570, Phoenix, AZ 85004
stateWideResources.address: 2800 N. Central Ave., Suite 1570, Phoenix, AZ 85004
stateWideResources.eligibility: Anyone affected by sexual or domestic violence in Arizona
stateWideResources.hours: Helpline: Mon 8:30-5, Tues 8:30-7, Wed-Fri 8:30-5; Office hours may vary
services: Referrals to local programs and shelters

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: Statewide coalition providing support and resources for sexual and domestic violence survivors through helpline services, local program connections, and resources.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Survivors of sexual and domestic violence

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security
stateWideResources.description: State agency providing various assistance programs
stateWideResources.notes: Distance to service centers creates access barriers

stateWideResources.name: 211 Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: Phone-based service helps overcome geographic barriers

stateWideResources.name: Wildfire Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: Limited direct services in remote areas

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: A state agency that coordinates homeless services through federal and state funds, contracting with nonprofit and local government entities to provide rapid rehousing, emergency shelter, homeless prevention, and street outreach services throughout Arizona.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing a housing crisis in Arizona

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS)
stateWideResources.description: Arizona's Medicaid agency that offers health care programs to serve Arizona residents. They provide resources for locating substance abuse treatment and opioid services throughout the state, including in Pinal County.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 602-417-4000 (General), 602-586-1841 or 1-800-624-3879 (Mercy Care Member Services for Pinal County) | Email: Contact through website | Address: 801 E. Jefferson, Phoenix, AZ 85034
stateWideResources.phone: 602-417-4000 (General), 602-586-1841 or 1-800-624-3879 (Mercy Care Member Services for Pinal County)
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona residents; some services available regardless of insurance status
stateWideResources.hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM; Crisis services available 24/7

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security (DES) Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: The DES Homeless Coordination Office contracts with nonprofit and local government entities to provide rapid rehousing, emergency shelter, homeless prevention, and street outreach services throughout Arizona, including Jerome.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Veterans' Services (ADVS)
stateWideResources.description: State-funded agency committed to serving Arizona veterans, service members, and their families by ensuring they receive high-quality services.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona veterans, service members, and their families

stateWideResources.name: Teen Lifeline
stateWideResources.description: Crisis line for teenagers where callers can talk to trained peer counselors about any problem or issue.
stateWideResources.hours: 3pm-9pm: Peer counselors; Other hours: Adult counselors

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security - Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: The DES Homeless Coordination Office contracts with not for profit and local government entities to provide homeless services throughout Arizona, including Cordes Lakes. Services include Rapid Rehousing, Emergency Shelter, Homeless Prevention, and Street Outreach.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 211 | Address: Statewide service covering Cordes Lakes, AZ
stateWideResources.address: Statewide service covering Cordes Lakes, AZ
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of becoming homeless
stateWideResources.hours: Varies by program, call 211 for information

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Department of Economic Security provides various support services for people with disabilities, seniors, and low-income families in Dewey-Humboldt. Their AZ Links program serves as Arizona's Aging and Disability Resource Center.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 844-770-9500 | Address: 1789 W. Jefferson, Phoenix, AZ 85007
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona residents with disabilities, seniors, and low-income families

countyWideResources.name: Apache Junction Community Resources - Domestic Violence Services
countyWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of domestic violence services and resources provided by the Apache Junction Police Department's Community Resource Unit, including crisis hotlines, emergency shelters, counseling services, and victim advocacy for individuals experiencing domestic violence.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Rayna Steffen, Public Information Officer | Phone: (480) 474-5442 | 24-hour My Sisters' Place Hotline: 480-821-1024 | Pathways Domestic Violence Counseling: 602-819-0082
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families affected by domestic violence
countyWideResources.notes: Provides connections to multiple domestic violence services including emergency shelters, crisis hotlines, counseling, and victim advocacy programs. Resources span both Pinal and Maricopa counties.

countyWideResources.name: Apache Junction Community Resources - Food and Basic Needs
countyWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of food assistance and basic needs resources provided by the Apache Junction Police Department's Community Resource Unit, including food banks, low-cost food programs, and support services for low-income families in Apache Junction.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Rayna Steffen, Public Information Officer | Phone: (480) 474-5442 | Superstition Community Food Bank: 480-983-2995
countyWideResources.eligibility: Low-income individuals and families in need of food assistance and basic needs
countyWideResources.notes: Provides connections to multiple food assistance programs including local food banks, low-cost food co-ops, and meal services. Resources include both local Apache Junction services and broader county resources.

countyWideResources.name: Apache Junction Community Resources - Homeless Services
countyWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of homeless services and resources provided by the Apache Junction Police Department's Community Resource Unit, including emergency shelters, housing assistance, and support services for individuals experiencing homelessness in Apache Junction and surrounding areas.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Rayna Steffen, Public Information Officer | Phone: (480) 474-5442 | I-HELP hotline: 480-722-8922 ext. 5000
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness
countyWideResources.notes: Provides connections to multiple homeless services including emergency shelters, I-HELP centers, housing assistance programs, and crisis hotlines. Resources span both Pinal and Maricopa counties.

countyWideResources.name: Pinal County VA Clinic
countyWideResources.description: An outpatient clinic that provides primary care and specialty health services for veterans, including registry exams, telehealth, and care for veterans who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-629-4801, 877-252-4866 | Email: Contact through phone | Address: 1179 East Cottonwood Lane, Casa Grande, AZ 85122-2969
countyWideResources.address: 1179 East Cottonwood Lane, Casa Grande, AZ 85122-2969
countyWideResources.eligibility: Veterans enrolled in VA health care
countyWideResources.hours: Monday-Friday: 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Saturday-Sunday: Closed

countyWideResources.name: Pinal County Housing Authority
countyWideResources.description: A county government agency that provides and maintains temporary safe, decent, and sanitary standardized housing for qualified low-income people, while assisting individuals in becoming independent through education, training, counseling, and support services.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: Contact through website | Email: Contact through website form | Address: Pinal County, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Qualified low-income individuals and families in Pinal County, including Casa Blanca
countyWideResources.hours: Contact for current hours of operation

countyWideResources.name: CAHRA (Community Action Human Resources Agency)
countyWideResources.description: A community action agency providing housing assistance, rent/utility assistance, and home repairs for low-income residents of Apache Junction and Pinal County.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 466-1112 | Email: Not specified | Address: Not specified - contact for location information
countyWideResources.address: Not specified - contact for location information
countyWideResources.eligibility: Low-income residents of Apache Junction and Pinal County
countyWideResources.hours: Not specified - contact for current hours

countyWideResources.name: Southern Arizona Veterans Affairs Health Care System
countyWideResources.description: A comprehensive healthcare system providing primary care, specialty care, mental health services, and other support services to veterans in Southern Arizona, including those in Pinal County.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-792-1450 | Email: Contact through website | Address: 3601 S. 6th Avenue, Tucson, AZ 85723 (Main facility)
countyWideResources.eligibility: Veterans enrolled in VA healthcare system
countyWideResources.hours: Varies by location and service; Main facility open 24/7 for emergency services

countyWideResources.name: Against Abuse, Inc.
countyWideResources.description: A nonprofit organization providing shelter and support services for victims of domestic violence in Casa Grande and surrounding areas, including Campo Bonito. They operate La Casa de Paz Women's Shelter with a 24-hour crisis line.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-836-0858 (Main), 520-836-0858 (24-Hour Crisis Line) | Email: Contact through phone | Address: P.O. Box 10733, Casa Grande, AZ 85230
countyWideResources.website: Listed in Casa Grande Resource Directory
countyWideResources.eligibility: Victims of domestic violence in Pinal County
services: Emergency shelter at La Casa de Paz Women's Shelter

countyWideResources.name: Community Action Human Resources Agency (CAHRA)
countyWideResources.description: A 501(c)(3) nonprofit designated as the Community Action Agency providing services to low income individuals and families throughout Pinal County, including housing assistance, utility assistance, and other support services.

countyWideResources.phone: Contact through website or visit in person

countyWideResources.description: A collaborative resource center for homeless individuals and those at risk of homelessness, providing centralized registration, screening, case management, and connections to various support services.

countyWideResources.notes: Operated by Community Action Human Resources Agency (CAHRA), a 501(c)(3) nonprofit designated as the Community Action Agency providing services to low income individuals and families throughout Pinal County.

countyWideResources.name: Honoring/Hiring/Helping Our Heroes of Pinal County (HOHP)
countyWideResources.description: A nonprofit organization committed to supporting veterans and military families throughout Pinal County, Arizona, providing direct services and connecting individuals to trusted providers who can assist with life's challenges.

localResources.name: Coolidge Youth Coalition
localResources.description: A nonprofit organization providing substance abuse prevention programs, awareness forums, and activities for youth in Coolidge. Their goal is to increase awareness of drug and alcohol abuse symptoms and provide resources for prevention and treatment.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 709-7350 | Email: Contact through Facebook | Address: Coolidge, AZ
services: Resource referrals for substance abuse prevention and treatment

localResources.name: Florence Immigrant & Refugee Rights Project
localResources.description: The Florence Project provides free legal services, social services, and advocacy to immigrants facing detention and potential deportation in Arizona. The organization serves as a lifeline for detained immigrants who would otherwise appear in court alone without an attorney.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: {'tucson': '(520) 777-5600', 'phoenix': '(602) 307-1008'} | Email: firrp@firrp.org | Address: {'tucson': 'P.O. Box 86299, Tucson, AZ 85754-6299', 'phoenix': 'P.O. Box 32670, Phoenix, AZ 85064'}
localResources.eligibility: Services are primarily for immigrants detained in Arizona immigration detention facilities. The organization does not have capacity to assist family visitors or walk-in clients without an appointment.
localResources.hours: Not specified for office hours; services provided directly in detention facilities
services: Free legal services for detained immigrants
Support for adults and children in immigration detention

localResources.description: Domestic violence shelter for women in Oracle, AZ

localResources.name: Ability360 - Coolidge
localResources.description: A nonprofit organization providing nationally-recognized home care services to seniors and people with disabilities for over 25 years, with a personalized approach to in-home care.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (602) 909-2720 | Email: Contact through website | Address: 1419 N. Arizona Blvd., Coolidge, AZ 85128

localResources.name: Hope Women's Center - Coolidge Center
localResources.description: A faith-based, trauma-informed nonprofit organization that provides vulnerable women and teen girls with education, mentoring, and support for their physical, emotional, and spiritual needs.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 723-8888 | Email: Contact through phone | Address: 2020 S. 9th Street, Coolidge, AZ 85128
localResources.eligibility: Women and teen girls (ages 13+) in Coolidge and surrounding areas
localResources.hours: Monday-Thursday: 9am-4pm (Closed 2nd Monday of every month for Staff Training), Friday: 9am-1pm
services: Life Skills, Parenting & Faith Based Education Classes
Celebrate Recovery and Substance Use Disorder Prevention
Hope at Work - Job Skills Classes & Training
Women's Boutique (material resources, utility, and transportation assistance)

localResources.name: Hope Women's Center - Coolidge
localResources.description: Hope Women's Center engages, encourages, and equips women and teen girls by providing physical, emotional, and spiritual support. They offer a holistic approach to addressing life challenges by providing tools and resources to help women discover their true value and worth.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 723-8888 | Email: Contact through website | Address: 2020 S. 9th Street, Coolidge, AZ 85128
localResources.hours: Monday: 9am-4pm (Closed 2nd Monday of every month for Staff Training), Tuesday: 9am-4pm, Wednesday: 9am-4pm, Thursday: 9am-4pm, Friday: 9am-1pm
